revised_title: Gamma-Ray Astronomy: Emissivity of Local Interstellar Medium and Gas Correlations
tldr: The article investigates the gamma-ray emissivity of the local interstellar medium by analyzing correlations with gas at intermediate latitudes using data from the SAS-2 and COS-B satellites. The study finds that the presence of a component of gamma-ray emission related to non-atomic gas is evident in both the SAS-2 and COS-B data, and the emissivities of each component can be independently determined. The results provide insights into the local gamma-ray emission and the properties of the interstellar medium.
